title: Slow S3 download datalad vs s3cmd

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
Working on https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/3901 I noticed that `download-url` seems relatively slow, and indeed it seems to take about 50-100% longer than a straight-up download via s3cmd -- with `--nosave`.

Here are same representative times for a 0.5M file and my current location in Europe:

```
% time s3cmd get s3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz d2
download: 's3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz' -> 'd2'  [1 of 1]
 586704 of 586704   100% in    1s   449.42 kB/s  done
s3cmd get s3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz d2  0.21s user 0.04s system 12% cpu 1.886 total
```

vs 

```
% time datalad download-url s3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz --nosave -O t4
[INFO   ] Downloading 's3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz' into '/tmp/s3test/t4' 
[INFO   ] S3 session: Connecting to the bucket hcp-openaccess with authentication 
<snip progressbar>
download_url(ok): /tmp/s3test/t4 (file)
datalad download-url s3://hcp-openaccess/HCP_1200/123420/T1w/ribbon.nii.gz  -  0.49s user 0.06s system 15% cpu 3.652 total
```

In both cases an untracked file is left in the worktree.

Is this to be expected? Does anyone have a clue on where to start looking for the cause?

Thx!
